history.content:
We are excited to announce that applications for NCWIT's Award for Aspirations in Computing are now open! 


Applications are now open!

Let’s revolutionize the face of technology together!

The Award for Aspirations in Computing and the NCWIT Collegiate Award recognize students who self-identify as women, genderqueer, or non-binary for their interest and participation in computing and tech. Please find more details below.


****NCWIT Collegiate Award - Preliminary Round deadline is October 15, 2019 ****

Are you or someone you know making a significant contribution to an innovative and impactful technical project? Apply now for the NCWIT Collegiate Award!

  • For undergraduate and graduate students who self-identify as women, genderqueer, or non-binary in technical fields of study

  • Register for upcoming Application Q&A live-video chats with an AiC Team Member

  • Encourage a collegiate student to apply


Award for Aspirations in Computing (AiC) - Deadline is November 5, 2019 

Accelerate your future in tech - apply for the AiC award today! Win recognition locally or nationally for your goals in computing. High school women with all levels of experience can apply now. 

  • For students who self-identify as women, genderqueer, or non-binary in grades 9-12 who are active and interested in computing and technology, at any and all skill levels

  • Register for upcoming Application Q&A live-video chats with an AiC Team Member

  • Encourage a high school student to apply


Aspirations in Computing  Educator Award - Deadline is December 2, 2019

  • For any teacher, counselor, administrator, mentor, or other influencer who supports high school women’s passion for computing and technology & endorses a current Award for Aspirations in Computing applicant 

  • Check your eligibility and apply now

  • Encourage an educator to apply
history.subject: NCWIT's Award for Aspirations in Computing
